result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry S. Parmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry S. Parmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry S. Parmer was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry S. Parmer in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF7, 16CF8, and 16CF44 for plea/sentencing.  PSI filed today.  DA addresses the Court re the parties' joint recommendation/agreement.  Court questions PSI author, Agent TS, re the PSI and questions DA re rationale for not charging homicide due to overdose death.  Counsel address the Court.  Def addresses the Court.  Court follows the joint recommendation:  

16CF7 and 16CF8, to the single count in each case, concurrent:  12 1/2 years prison with 7 1/2 years confinement and 5 years extended supervision.  Conditions of ES:  same conditions as provided in PSI - provide DNA sample, random ua's, no possess/consumption of alcohol; any assessments and programming at discretion of supervising agent; all restitution if ordered (State not asking for any); court-ordered financial obligations.

Firearm admonishment.

Credit:  57 days.

One set of costs imposed - 16CF7.

Program eligibility.

Count 2 in 16CF8 dismissed.  16CF44 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Def from the R Co Jail

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Larry S. Parmer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Larry S. Parmer appeared by video means.  16CF7 and 16CF8, both originally on the calendar for sentencing, and 16CF44/adjourned initial.  DA informs the Court that, due to recent information received in this matters, "landscape" of these cases has changed.  Counsel requests plea/sentencing in all three cases.  Court sets 4/22 at 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Three cases called together (16CF44, 16CF07, 16CF08) Defendant Larry S. Parmer appeared via video from RC jail.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Larry S. Parmer. DA requests cash posted in 16CF7 be refunded to poster, reinstate signature bond in 16CF8 and reinstate cash bond in 16CF8 and set bond in 16CF44 in amount of $5000 cash. No objection. Court orders: 16CF44-$5000 cash bond. 16CF7-reinstate $10,000 cash, refund $5000 posted to bond poster, 16CF8-reinstate $10,000 signature bond. Set for 04/15/16 @ 10.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 04-15-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Larry S. Parmer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Status in 16CF7 and 16CF8.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties are ready to proceed to resolution with def pleading to one count from each case (single count/delivery of heroine in 16CF7 and count 1/manufacture/deliver narcotics in 16CF8); PSI to be requested; joint recommendation to be presented.  Def pleads no contest to the two counts stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Count 2 dismissed.  Counsel request sentencing hearing in approx. 60 days; notes that def's current bail require that he be with LB but she's not available for one week in March.  Counsel will be making a request for change in def's bail (not making the request today; waiting til they have details about the dates LB won't be available to stay with def).  Sentencing set for 4/15 at 10.

PSI ordered.  Due 4/1.  PSI writer to be present or at least available by phone.

ADDRESS INFO for Larry S. Parmer
Current: 1017 Bay Ridge Rd, Madison, WI 53716 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: 703 Willow Street, Arena, WI 53503
Status conference at 02-10-2016 01:30 pm

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court with Defendant Larry S. Parmer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 16CF7 and 16CF8 called together.  Bond conditions amended and cash bond lowered in 16CF7, conditions that LP reside with Louise Billings and physically be with her or be at work, also he must need to let dispatch know where he works and his hours at work.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance; can attend religious services.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm
Status conference at 02-01-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Larry S. Parmer in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  16CF7 and 16CF8, for both preliminary hearing and bail review.  Atty. M asks for reduction of bail in 16CF7 where cash bail was set at 10k cash; asks for cash to be reduced to 1k cash.  Defense waives prelim rights in both cases.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  DA has filed the informations.  Court states the charges.  Atty. M enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Re Defense' request to lower bail, parties address the Court.  Court denies the request.  Status requested by the Defense and set by the Court for Monday, 2/1 at 1:30 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's

Bail/Bond Review at 01-25-2016 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 01-25-2016 02:00 pm.

16CF7 and 16CF8/initials in both.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Larry S. Parmer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Larry S. Parmer appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Court states charges in both cases and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim.  DA addresses Court re issue pertaining to prelims - State wants prelim in one of the cases but defense wants to waive prelim; State wonders if it can "force" the prelim (wide open prelim wanted in 16CF7).  Court provisionally rules State can persist on having a prelim and will schedule a prelim, allowing Defense opportunity to research and argue further on the matter.  Atty. M - Defense waives 10-day time limits for prelim; asks for bail review scheduling prior to Feb. 3rd.  Court sets Monday, Jan. 25 at 2 for prelim in both cases.  Bail review hearings will be held at the same time.  Atty. M - def waives time limits on prelim up to the 25th of Jan.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim time limit waiver.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
REFUSED TO SIGN
Initial appearance at 01-11-2016 11:00 am

2 cases called together (16CF7 & 8). Defendant Larry S. Parmer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received copies of the complaint, requests more time to review. Initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
